full_summary:
# Highway 19 Flood Damage Reinstatement – Riding Mountain National Park

## Government Tender Announcement

### Title and Reference Information

* Title: Highway 19 Flood Damage Reinstatement – Riding Mountain National Park
* Reference Number: PW-22-01003728
* Solicitation Number: 5P468-22-0080/A
* Amendment Number: 3

### Tender Information

* Tender Closing Date and Time: 2022-08-30T15:00:00 (Eastern Daylight Time)
* Expected Contract Start and End Dates: Not provided
* Tender Status: Expired

### Contract Description

Parks Canada invites contractors to submit bids for the Highway 19 Flood Damage Reinstatement project in Riding Mountain National Park. The project aims to restore multiple sections of Highway 19 that were severely damaged due to spring flooding. The work includes creating a temporary ditch and adding culverts.

The estimated value of the project ranges between $1,000,001 to $5,000,000, excluding taxes. A two-submission bid process will be followed.

### Selection Criteria and Benefits

The contractor is expected to provide socioeconomic benefits to Indigenous communities within the area covered by the contract. The bid shall be submitted following a two-submission procedure.

### Contact Information

For technical and contractual enquiries, please contact:
Kenneth Lacanilao
Contracting Authority
Parks Canada
(587) 832-1894
kenneth.lacanilao@pc.gc.ca

### Important Notes

* only email responses will be accepted using the email address soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca
* late submissions will not be considered
* documents can be submitted in either English or French
* addenda and bid documents are available on the Government Electronic Tendering Service

### Trade and Procurement Information

* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Procurement Method: Competitive – Open Bidding
* Contract Category: CNST

Please note that this tender announcement is for a closed contract.  Please see attachments for bid documents.  The attachment link provided above will guide you to know how to get the correct documents for you bid submissions.   Bid should be submitted accordingly and verify completeness so as not to incur timel delay or negotiation closing optional.  Mandatory compliance may be requested of bidder and bidder submitted supporting document. Italics a mandatory portion where compliance to government terms to mandatory guarded.    Judges will view governed tenders for the bids afforded tomorrow
